intro: Serratula bocconei, commonly known as the Boccone's golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually serrated, giving it its scientific name. Serratula bocconei is often found in California and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
